args: I'm certain that he's here in the village.\nYou ought to run into him if you head\nto the square.
(Sandalphon, this is Ramiel. We've found\na subject from whom we can learn of\nthe current state of the southern Church.)
(The person is a retired archbishop whose\nrelationship with the Church is said to be\nstrained at best.)
(Understood. Be cautious not to alert the\nsouthern Church to your investigation.)
I tell you, that ability to communicate with\nother archangels from anywhere is just the\ndarnedest thing. SO useful!
Indeed it is. And if I could speak in YOUR\nmind no matter where you toddled off to,\nI'd be better able to keep track of you.
We gotta hit the kid thing again? Really?\nC'mon, let's hurry up and talk to that\nformer archbishop.
And without allowing him to realize\nwho we are and what we want.\nDo you have a line of questioning ready?
Well, it's hard to imagine that information\nabout the gaolstone would've made it\nall the way to the south.
So I'm going to ask him for people from\nthe southern Church who have been\ntraveling to and from the north.

To honor one's parents is to love 'em for
all their lives. Even if they're distant and
you can't help out, the best way to honor
'em is with feelings of respect.
Thanks! I feel much better now.
Mind chatting with us a second, old timer?
'Course! If you're willing to listen,\nol' Ryozen is always ready to talk.
Perfect. See, we're actually looking\nfor someone.

Recently, we were beset by fiends in the
north—but on the verge of death, someone
from the southern Church came to our aid.
We've come here to express our gratitude.
Ah, this sounds right up my alley!\nNow then, what can you tell me about\nthis mystery benefactor of yours?
Yeah, that's the thing. We were so busy\nalmost-dying, we don't remember much.

After the fact, we asked around and
learned that the person was from the
southern Church. But beyond that,
I fear we know very little.
Well, that sure ain't much to go on...\nAh, but hold on there!
If you talk with Lay the Hands, you might\nbe able to learn something.

It is a service organization of priests with
medical knowledge. They recently visited
several battlefields in the north to offer
succor and healing to the wounded.
Well, ain't that a thing.\nSo where is this group now?
They're based in the local church\nof a town called Closeheide.
No trouble at all, my son! None a'tall...\nBy the by, do you believe that a black kite\nraised by a hawk can truly be a hawk?
This some kind of weird Q&A?\nA hawk is a hawk, and a kite's a kite.
But if the kite mimics the hawk as it flies,\neventually it may soar as the hawk does.
But they can't get impatient. They must\nfly together, watch closely, and learn.
That sounds like useful advice.\nEr, so why are you telling me?
Mayhap the little bug in ol' Ryozen's ear\nsaid it would be a good idea! Hee hee!
...I've heard rumors of you lot for some\ntime now. Won't ask the particulars,\nbut I wish ya good fortunes.
Strange old coot, wasn't he? Still,\nhe hooked us up with some solid intel.

Indeed. If this ＂Lay the Hands＂ group has
been coming and going from the north,
it behooves us to investigate whether or
not there is anything suspect about them.

Evidently, the priest who serves as the
representative of Lay the Hands has been
active outside the group, traveling the
north and performing labor services.
His money situation seems rather on the\nhigh side for one who has been traipsing\nabout handing out free labor.
According to some of the laity, this priest\nalso used to always wear a halo necklace,\nbut has recently stopped doing so.
We're gonna have this thing wrapped up\nbefore dinner. Must be Papa Bear's reward\nfor all his tireless hard work.
If there is hard work to be rewarded,\nit is my own. After all, I take great pains\nto look after you in all your slovenly glory.
And here I was just thinking I needed a\ngrumpy lecture! But alas, we'll have to\nsave it for later. C'mon, let's go inside.
The representative ought to be here at this\ntime of day, but... Ah! That smell!
Yeah, I smell it too. Blood.
S'cuse me? Are you the representative for\nLay the Han—Cripes! You're wounded!
Stay with me, friend! Come on!\n...Dammit. He's gone.
Judging from his wounds, the weapon\nwas a kukri—a kind of machete. Not an\naltogether common blade in the south.
Also note how the body is cut in a broad\nstroke from lower right to upper left.
Meaning the culprit was likely left-handed.\nAnd they did this in a single blow,\nwhich takes some serious skill.
We've searched the church from steeple to\nbasement, but no sign of the gaolstone.\nWhat do you make of this situation?

Priests aren't usually known for their
fighting skills, and I can't imagine our
dead friend back there posing a threat
to a Templar.

Which means he had an accomplice that's
good with the rough stuff. But after having
the Templar killed, he ended up getting a
taste of his own medicine.
Meaning we're either looking for a\nmercenary well-versed in combat,\nor an assassin accustomed to murder.
Either way, not someone you want\nhanging around at your birthday party.
Nonetheless, we must search for them;\nit is likely that the accomplice is the one\nwith the object we seek.
Then let's split up and find 'em!
